content.description: Sit start.
content.location: From the trail: walk around the huge central boulder to the right.

content.description: Start left.
content.location:
On the

Hexing

boulder.

When hiking up from Pratt, the

Hexing

boulder is the first of the developed boulders you will reach. Just off the trail to the right, pass through the archway of branches.

content.description: Slab with many variations.
content.location:
On the

Hexing

boulder.

When hiking up from Pratt, the

Hexing

boulder is the first of the developed boulders you will reach. Just off the trail to the right. Pass through the archway of branches.

content.description:
An eliminate. The aréte above the kink is off.

Get a right hand on the aréte below the kink. Stem out left and find a good foot on a protruding, purple stone.  Rock over onto the slick cobble,  slapping high and left on some really desperate slopers. Keeping the left foot from popping off the slick stone is tough.

Finish by moving left until you can easily top out.
content.location:
Very near the

Hexing

' boulder.  Slightly down trail and a bit deeper in the brush. Look for the eye-catching, 8 foot aréte.

Same start as for

Forgotten Ruin

but head left.

content.description:
Sit-start using a couple cobbles for hands. One big move to the top.

A lower start has been done, adding one move (V6).
content.location:
From the trail: walk past the overhanging problems on the central boulder to reach the

RBG

boulder and you will be facing it.

content.description: Traverse left and up. Sandy.
content.location:
On the

Hexing

boulder.

When hiking up from Pratt, the

Hexing

boulder is the first of the developed boulders you will reach. Just off the trail to the right. Pass through the archway of branches.

content.description: Three mantels to the top.
content.location: On the huge, central boulder. Three giant steps.

content.description:
Climb the middle of the face. The quality of the rock is great, a hint of what awaits up the trail.

The problem must be down-climbed once topped out due to bushes blocking other options.
content.location: About halfway between The Foot and The Hideout, along the trail, is an obvious line on a boulder to the right.

content.description:
Sit-start using a sloper for the left and a mono for the right.

The first move is the crux. The problem is perhaps V2 if you skip the first move.
content.location:
On the huge, central boulder.

Towards the left of the overhanging wall.

content.description:
Sit-start beneath the roof.

Start with your left hand in the crack and your right in a dish. Tricky.
content.location:
From the trail: walk past the overhanging problems on the central boulder to reach the

RBG

boulder. Walk left around the

RBG

boulder.

Snakefinger

is just around the first turn.

content.description:
Traverse across the start of

The Hexing

, moving from right to left. Turn the aréte to finish.
content.location:
On the

Hexing

boulder.

When hiking up from Pratt, the Hexing boulder is the first of the developed boulders you will reach. Just off the trail to the right. Pass through the archway of branches.

content.description: Sit start and traverse right, finding the best slopers you can.
content.location:
From the trail: walk past the overhanging problems on the central boulder to reach the

RBG

boulder.

Sit start the leftmost side of the face and traverse right.

content.description: Traverse past 'The Hexing', left to right.
content.location:
On the

Hexing

boulder.

When hiking up from Pratt, the

Hexing

boulder is the first of the developed boulders you will reach. Just off the trail to the right. Pass through the archway of branches.

content.description: Sit start matched on the open handed rail.
content.location:
Just a few feet from the

Hexing

boulder.

When hiking up from Pratt, the

Hexing

boulder is the first of the developed boulders you will reach. Just off the trail to the right. Pass through the archway of branches.

content.description: Sit start the short face and head up the series of jugs to an interesting, open handed top-out.
content.location:
From the trail: walk past the overhanging problems on the central boulder to reach the

RBG

boulder.

Ojai Steez

starts tucked against the oak and a bit to the right.

content.description: Start low on the left-side aréte.
content.location: From the trail: walk around the huge, central boulder to the right.

content.description:
Begin from a sit and gain the aréte. A couple pockets up high lead to the top.

The standing start is V4.
content.location:
On the huge, central boulder.

Mystical Weapons

climbs the aréte on the right side of the tall face. Climb the aréte on its left side.

content.description: Start from two side-pulls.
content.location:
Behind the huge, central boulder.

From the trail, walk around the huge boulder to the right.

content.description:
Stand start with a big reach; left hand palming the aréte, right hand on the small sidepull. Pretty grainy. Maybe it will clean up.

A monster sit start waits to be done...
content.location:
Behind the huge, central boulder.

From the trail, walk around the huge boulder to the right.

content.description:
Climb the slabby face right of the

Mystical Weapons

aréte.
content.location:
On the huge, central boulder.

From the trail, walk around the huge boulder to the right.

The Hobohemian

is immediately around the first bend.

content.description: Stand start with the left hand on a cobble and the right on a rounded crimp.
content.location:
When hiking up from Pratt, the

Hexing

boulder is the first of the developed boulders you will reach. Just off the trail to the right. Pass through the archway of branches.

content.description:
Sit start the overhanging face, below the right facing jug.

There is a good starting edge for the left hand and some funky, shallow pockets for the right.

The first move is the crux, a tough huck to the jug.
content.location:
On the huge, central boulder.

Find the overhanging wall. Sit start below the right facing jug.

content.description: Slab and aréte.
content.location:
Very near the

Hexing

boulder.  Slightly down trail and a bit deeper in the brush.

content.description:
The tall face on the huge boulder. From a stand, climb the face directly.

Excellent.
content.location:
On the huge, central boulder.

The direct line up the center of the tall face, obvious from the trail.

content.description:
Hand traverse across the lip, left to right. Pump inducing.

Begin on the lip's far left side. Traverse along the lip, topping out above

Cosmic Hand

.

An easier variation traverses to

The Talisman

and tops out via the crack (V2).
content.location:
On the huge, central boulder.

Traverse the lip on the overhanging side, left to right.

content.description: Begin from a sit and climb the aréte.
content.location: From the trail: walk around the huge, central boulder to the right.

content.description:
One really tough move to the lip, then mantel directly.

Begin from a sit, using the very small crimps just below the horizontal seam.
content.location:
On the huge, central boulder.

The Diamond Cutter

is the shortest and furthest left of the problems on the overhanging face.

content.description: Obvious start, follow the crack then top out.  Very dirty top out into some plants depending on density of vegetation.
content.location: Left most crack on the hill above the main area.  Kinda of steep and bushy trail.

climbs.name: Cosmic Lotus aka The Green Hand

content.description: Really just a variation. Sit start between Green Lotus and Cosmic Hand, using features from each.  Top out directly.  With this one you get to use the best holds from both problems plus another cool lip encounter.
content.location:
On the huge, central boulder.

Find the overhanging side.  Sit start just left of the tree.

content.description:
Start from a sit and traverse, right to left. Finish up

The Phage.

The crux is avoiding the butt dab.
content.location:
On the

Phage

boulder, next to the

Hexing

boulder.

When hiking up from Pratt, the

Hexing

boulder is the first of the developed boulders you will reach. Just off the trail to the right. Pass through the archway of branches.

content.description:
Start from a sit, straddling the steep aréte left of

The Hexing

. Climb the aréte and face, staying right.

The stand is V2.
content.location:
On the

Hexing

boulder.

When hiking up from Pratt, the

Hexing

boulder is the first of the developed boulders you will reach. Just off the trail to the right. Pass through the archway of branches.

content.description:
The easy problem just right of

The Hexing

.
content.location:
On the

Hexing

boulder.

When hiking up from Pratt, the

Hexing

boulder is the first of the developed boulders you will reach. Just off the trail to the right. Pass through the archway of branches.
